author: @Dailyhuntapp
title: Rihanna Arrives In Jamnagar For Anant Ambani-Radhika Merchant Pre-Wedding. WATCH
text:
Popstar Rihanna has finally arrived in Jamnagar to attend the pre-wedding ceremony of anant Ambani with Radhika Merchant. Reportedly, she will be perfoming at the event and will take the stage along with renowned magician David Blaine, singing sensations Arijit Singh, Ajay-Atul, Diljit Dosanjh, and more. Earlier, her team had come to the Gujrat-city with an enormous luggage, comprising huge cartons and boxes as they make their way to the venue.
Rihanna was dressed in a black printed top paired with purple cargo pants. In addition, she tied a piece of cloth around her waist and had a small black purse in her carrying. People were excited to see her and they all gathered to give her a warm welcome.
üé•: Rihanna arrived in India for her performance at Anant Ambani & Radhika Merchant‚Äôs pre-wedding ceremony. pic.twitter.com/DnzujDJIBK
‚Äî ùñåùñÜùñá (@gabgonebad) February 29, 2024 \n\n
Previously, her team also received warm welcome amid beats of dandiya and garba.
Look at Rihanna Reaction as she is arrives at Jamnagar to perform at Anant Ambani Radhika Merchant Wedding üòç #AnantAmbani #RadhikaMerchant #MukeshAmbani #AnantRadhikaWedding pic.twitter.com/bE0fcgxHRF
‚Äî Rosy (@rose_k01) February 29, 2024 \n\n
Apart from Rihanna, the global guest list also includes Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg, Morgan Stanley CEO Ted Pick, Microsoft founder Bill Gates, Disney CEO Bob Iger, BlackRock CEO Larry Fink, Adnoc CEO Sultan Ahmed Al Jaber, and EL Rothschild chair Lynn Forester de Rothschild.
Scheduled from March 1 to 3, the pre-wedding festivities will include the delightful elements of traditional Indian family celebrations, featuring music, dance, carnival activities, visual artistry, and a surprise performance. For the three-day celebration, the Ambani family has organized themed nights, complete with dress codes, allowing guests to fully immerse themselves in the festivities in authentic desi style.
All guests will travel to Jamnagar on chartered flights from Mumbai or Delhi between 8am and 1pm on March 1. In addition, they will receive personalised services such as laundry, saree draping, and other custom assistance. Despite providing a detailed dress code, the Ambani family has emphasised in the guidebook that guests should prioritise comfort, encouraging them to enjoy each moment to the fullest and make beautiful memories that last a lifetime.
Rihanna's Team Arrives In Jamnagar To Attend Anant Ambani-Radhika Merchant's Pre-Wedding: Take A Look At Her Enormous Luggage
Author : ABP News Bureau

author: Ana de los √Ångeles Mart√≠
title: "El a√±o pasado ten√≠amos ambulancias casi a diario en el mercado para llevarse a personas porque les hab√≠a dado un golpe de calor"
text: La ola de calor se est√° cebando con el Mercado Central, un espacio emblem√°tico de Val√®ncia, que atrae a numerosa clientela y turistas al reclamo de la cantidad de productos frescos que pueden encontrarse: pescader√≠a, embutidos, verdura, fruta, reposter√≠a, encurtidos y un largo etc...Las altas temperaturas que se est√°n alcanzando en el interior estos d√≠as han desatado el enfado de los vendedores, que advierten de las dif√≠ciles condiciones en las que trabajan por el bochorno, de las aver√≠as que el calor est√° provocando en las c√°maras de refrigeraci√≥n, que sometidas a un intenso esfuerzo se estropean continuamente. Algunos vendedores describen que ellos y sus clientes han sufrido incluso golpes de calor.

author: Kristin Houser
title: One-shot gene therapy reverses vision loss in small trial
text:
One-shot gene therapy reverses vision loss in small trial It has the potential to save people from blindness or a lifetime of eye injections. By Kristin Houser April 4, 2024 Fields Medicine Share
Copy a link to the article entitled One-shot gene therapy reverses vision loss in small trial
Share One-shot gene therapy reverses vision loss in small trial on Twitter (X)
Share One-shot gene therapy reverses vision loss in small trial on Facebook REGENXBIO / Adobe Stock / Freethink By Kristin Houser April 4, 2024 Fields Medicine Share
Copy a link to the article entitled One-shot gene therapy reverses vision loss in small trial
Share One-shot gene therapy reverses vision loss in small trial on Twitter (X)
Share One-shot gene therapy reverses vision loss in small trial on Facebook By Kristin Houser April 4, 2024 Fields Medicine Share
Copy a link to the article entitled One-shot gene therapy reverses vision loss in small trial
Share One-shot gene therapy reverses vision loss in small trial on Twitter (X)
Share One-shot gene therapy reverses vision loss in small trial on Facebook A gene therapy for the most common cause of severe vision loss in seniors is now in phase 3 trials ‚Äî and if approved, it could replace a lifetime of eye injections with a one-time procedure.
The challenge: Wet age-related macular degeneration (wet AMD) is a condition where abnormal blood vessels start to grow in the eyes. These vessels then leak fluid into the eye, causing blurred vision or blind spots .
While it isn‚Äôt certain why wet AMD develops, researchers have linked it to the overproduction of a protein in the eyes, called ‚Äúvascular endothelial growth factor‚Äù (VEGF).
‚ÄúReal-world evidence shows patients are losing significant vision over time.‚Äù
Jeffrey S. Heier The good news is that medications, called ‚Äú anti-VEGFs ,‚Äù can now block VEGF, restoring vision or at least stopping the progression of wet AMD. The bad news: they have to be injected directly into the eye every 4 to 8 weeks, sometimes indefinitely.
Understandably, patients have a very hard time with this.
‚ÄúWet AMD is a chronic, life-long disease,‚Äù said Jeffrey S. Heier, director of retina research at Ophthalmic Consultants of Boston (OCB). ‚Äú[R]eal-world evidence shows patients are losing significant vision over time, and the burden of frequent anti-VEGF injections needed to manage their wet AMD is a major reason why.‚Äù
What‚Äôs new? Maryland-based biotech company REGENXBIO is developing a one-shot gene therapy for wet AMD, called ABBV-RGX-314. It delivers genetic instructions for making anti-VEGF proteins into the eye, essentially teaching it to create its own medicine.
‚ÄúThis is the largest in vivo gene therapy program ever conducted.‚Äù
Steve Pakola On March 28, REGENXBIO published the results of a phase 1/2a trial of the gene therapy, which is now being administered to participants in phase 3 trials.
‚ÄúBased on this data, we created a global strategic collaboration with [pharmaceutical company] AbbVie to start a 1,200-patient pivotal program,‚Äù Steve Pakola, REGENXBIO‚Äôs chief medical officer, told Gen Edge . ‚ÄúThis is the largest in vivo gene therapy program ever conducted.‚Äù
The trial: During the early stage trial, 42 people who had been treated with anti-VEGFs for their wet AMD received a single subretinal injection of ABBV-RGX-314, in one of five dosing levels.
Trial participants were then followed for two years. If a participant‚Äôs vision worsened during that time, a trial investigator could opt to administer a traditional anti-VEGF injection.
There was one serious adverse event that may have been linked to the gene therapy ‚Äî a participant experienced pigmentary changes in their macula and severe vision reduction one year after treatment ‚Äî but it was otherwise well tolerated and appeared safe.
Participants that received what were considered therapeutic doses saw their vision either stabilize or improve, and most participants required few, if any, injections of anti-VEGFs during the trial.
‚ÄúA single treatment of ABBV-RGX-314 ‚Ä¶ would offer a novel approach to treating this serious and blinding disease.‚Äù
Jeffrey S. Heier The limitation: Subretinal injections are more complex and invasive than the ones used to administer traditional anti-VEGFs ‚Äî they must be done in an operating room and require a surgeon to perform a highly challenging technique called a ‚Äúpars plana vitrectomy.‚Äù
Trial investigators are now testing an alternative method where ABBV-RGX-314 is delivered to a part of the eye called the ‚Äúsuprachoroidal space,‚Äù a procedure that could be performed in a doctor‚Äôs office.
Looking ahead: REGENXBIO aims to apply for approval with the FDA in late-2025 or the first half of 2026, and even if subretinal injection is the only delivery method that works, people with wet AMD might decide that one of those procedures is preferable to many injections of anti-VEGFs.
‚ÄúA single treatment of ABBV-RGX-314 that can potentially provide long-lasting treatment outcomes and a strong safety profile would offer a novel approach to treating this serious and blinding disease,‚Äù said Heier, who is the trial‚Äôs primary investigator.
We‚Äôd love to hear from you! If you have a comment about this article or if you have a tip for a future Freethink story, please email us at [email protected] .

author: Michelle Starr
title: Most Powerful Solar Flare in 7 Years Blasts Earth: Expect Stunning Auroras
text: The Sun just unleashed the most powerful flare we've seen in seven years. On October 3, a flare measured at a strength of X9.0 [exploded right in the middle of the solar disk](https://www.swpc.noaa.gov/news/another-r3-strong-flare-erupts-region-3842-03-october-2024). Even more excitingly, it was accompanied by what is known as a halo coronal mass ejection ‚Äì one that is ejected straight at Earth. It's the second X-class flare of October 2024, both emitted from the same active sunspot region, and the most powerful since September 2017, when the Sun unleashed a ripper, later determined to [clock in at X11.88](https://www.spaceweatherlive.com/en/solar-activity/top-50-solar-flares.html). Solar flares are currently rampant because the Sun is in the [peak of its 11-year activity cycle](https://www.sciencealert.com/the-suns-rampant-activity-is-likely-to-peak-really-really-soon-study), letting them off [daily since early 2022](https://www.sciencealert.com/solar-storms-are-lashing-earth-and-you-re-going-to-be-fine). Most of the flares are smaller explosions, but we're definitely seeing an uptick in X-class flares, the most powerful category that we can measure. The X9.0 of October 3 is among [the top 20 most powerful flares on record](https://www.spaceweatherlive.com/en/solar-activity/top-50-solar-flares.html). It erupted from a sunspot region called AR 3842, which has a particularly [complex magnetic configuration](https://www.spaceweatherlive.com/en/help/the-magnetic-classification-of-sunspots.html) referred to as a 'Beta-Gamma-Delta' classification. Sunspots are spots on the Sun where the magnetic field is temporarily stronger. They're also magnetically messy; magnetic field lines of opposite polarity can tangle, snap, and reconnect. This reconnection unleashes a burst of energy ‚Äì a solar flare. Beta-Gamma sunspot regions contain zones of opposing polarity that don't easily connect. Deltas have opposing polarities crammed into a smaller space, which raises the chances the whole spot will become a region of repeat, intense activity. This is what we're seeing now with AR 3842. On October 1, [it unleashed an X7.1 flare](https://www.sciencealert.com/the-sun-unleashed-a-huge-solar-flare-at-earth-and-were-on-aurora-alert). Then it upped the ante with the X9.0. Solar flares can be disruptive to Earth. We're safe here on the surface, since X- and gamma radiation can't travel far into the atmosphere; but the powerful burst of radiation can briefly interfere with high-frequency radio communications systems. The strongest effects are felt with a coronal mass ejection, or CME. These often ‚Äì but not always ‚Äì occur with solar flares. An expulsion of billions of tons of solar particles and tangled magnetic fields that blast through the Solar System, CMEs can take a few days to reach us, but when they do, the particles interact with Earth's magnetosphere to power a [geomagnetic storm](https://sciencealert.com/geomagnetic-storms), with several consequences. Electric currents generated high up in the atmosphere can result in power grid fluctuations, and voltage corrections may need to be applied, for example. There is increased drag on satellites, which can require course correction. Satellite communications and GPS can be disrupted. For a single CME, even one accompanying a powerful flare, the effects are unlikely to cause too many problems, but [we are likely to see auroras, down as far 50 degrees latitude](https://www.swpc.noaa.gov/noaa-scales-explanation). Auroras are caused by solar particles slamming into Earth's magnetic field, and getting channeled and accelerated along magnetic field lines to high latitudes, where they are dumped out into the upper atmosphere. Their interactions with particles in the atmosphere result in ionization, which causes it to glow in colors that vary depending on the ratio of elements in the atmosphere. It's pretty much the same mechanism behind energizing neon in fluorescent lights, just on a much, much bigger scale. We were already on aurora alert from the X7.1 flare and CME that accompanied it. A [halo CME](https://www.spaceweather.com/glossary/halocmes.html) is one that is directed right at Earth; we're going to catch the brunt of it, and the [NOAA is forecasting several days of peak aurora conditions](https://www.swpc.noaa.gov/news/g3-strong-watches-effect-04-06-october-two-cmes-route). Some of the most powerful [geomagnetic storms](https://sciencealert.com/geomagnetic-storms) are the result of a [cannibal CME](https://www.sciencealert.com/cannibal-cme-is-about-to-deliver-spectacular-auroras-to-earths-atmosphere), where two CMEs are released in relatively quick succession, and the second overtakes and engulfs the first for a giant influx of solar particles. The two CMEs we're expecting now were released days apart, so we're probably not going to see that here. But conditions for aurora are strong, and will remain so [through the weekend](https://www.spaceweatherlive.com/en/auroral-activity/aurora-forecast.html). It might be time to plan some skywatching to catch one of the most glorious shows our planet has to offer.

author: VNExplorer
title: Alabama QB Jalen Milroe says ex-OC Bill O'Brien told him to change positions
text:
When asked how O'Brien's suggestion made him feel, Milroe responded, "How would you feel if I told you 'you suck?'"
Alabama quarterback Jalen Milroe has the No. 4 Crimson Tide two wins away from a national championship.
But Milroe has been met with doubters along his route to the 2023 College Football Playoff, including one of his former Alabama coaches.
Speaking at a press conference Thursday, Milroe revealed that ex-Alabama offensive coordinator and current New England Patriots OC Bill O‚ÄôBrien told him to change positions.
‚ÄúMy own offensive coordinator Bill O‚ÄôBrien told me I shouldn‚Äôt play quarterback,‚Äù Milroe told reporters. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs something I have motivation from.‚Äù
When asked how O‚ÄôBrien‚Äôs suggestion made him feel, Milroe responded, ‚ÄúHow would you feel if I told you ‚Äòyou suck?'‚Äù
‚ÄúThe biggest thing for me is stay true to myself and stay the same,‚Äù he continued. ‚ÄúThe only thing that changed about me is that I had an opportunity and I seized it. I had a bigger purpose than anyone‚Äôs opinion.‚Äù
O‚ÄôBrien was Alabama‚Äôs offensive coordinator for two seasons from 2021-22. Milroe, a redshirt sophomore, said O‚ÄôBrien told him there were ‚Äúa bunch‚Äù of positions he could have switched to.
‚ÄúBut look where I‚Äôm at right now,‚Äù Milroe added. ‚ÄúSo who gets the last laugh?‚Äù
Alabama QB Jalen Milroe says his former OC and current Patriots OC Bill O'Brien told him he should not be a quarterback.‚ÄùHow would you feel if I told you that you sucked?‚Äù
‚ÄúLook where I'm at right now. So who gets the last laugh?‚Äùpic.twitter.com/xurEAr61ge
‚Äî Ari Meirov (@MySportsUpdate) December 28, 2023
Milroe took over the starting quarterback reins this season after No. 1 overall pick Bryce Young departed for the NFL. The Katy, Texas, native was actually benched against South Florida in Week 3 following Alabama‚Äôs loss to Texas. But he re-entered the lineup the following week and hasn‚Äôt looked back since.
The 6-2, 220-pound signal-caller has tallied 2,718 yards, 23 touchdowns and six interceptions with a 65.5 completion percentage this season. He‚Äôs also been a factor on the ground, rushing for 468 yards and 12 scores.
Milroe has led Alabama to a perfect 10-0 record since his benching, most recently beating the undefeated two-time defending national champion Georgia Bulldogs in the SEC Championship Game to punch the Crimson Tide‚Äôs ticket to the CFP. His stellar season earned him a sixth-place finish in voting for the 2023 Heisman Trophy.
Milroe and Co. will now look to take down another undefeated foe when they face No. 1 Michigan in the Rose Bowl on New Year‚Äôs Day.
The 2023 College Football Playoff will feature Michigan, Alabama, Washington and Texas and will be the final year with a four-team format. Here is how the CFP works and what‚Äôs ahead for the 2024 season.

author: Jana St√§bener
title: ‚ÄûHat fast mein Leben ruiniert" - Mutter testet umstrittene Erziehungsmethode
text:
‚ÄûHat fast mein Leben ruiniert‚Äú ‚Äì Mutter testet umstrittene Erziehungsmethode
S√º√ükartoffelklumpen statt Babybrei: Mein Kind ‚Äûw√ºrgte so heftig, dass er sich √ºbergab‚Äú, schreibt eine Mutter, die Baby Led Weaning ausprobiert hat.
S√§uglinge saugen, Babys mampfen Brei und Kleinkinder knabbern Kekse ‚Äì oder? Nicht, wenn sich ihre Eltern f√ºr die ‚ÄûBaby Led Weaning‚Äú-Methode (BLW) entscheiden. Bei der wird der Brei √ºbersprungen. Sobald der Zungenstreckreflex (feste Nahrung wird automatisch wieder aus dem Mund bef√∂rdert) mit etwa sechs Monaten verschwunden ist, d√ºrfen sie bereits gekochte Karottenschnitze oder Fleischst√ºcke ansabbern.
Bei dieser ‚Äûbreifreien Beikosteinf√ºhrung‚Äú ern√§hren sich Babys immer noch haupts√§chlich vom Stillen, betonen Bef√ºrworter der F√ºtter-Methode. Durch die feste Beikost, die sie nur angeboten, nie aufgezwungen bekommen, lernen sie bis zum Abstillen (mit etwa zwei Jahren) verschiedene Geschm√§cker kennen und selbstbestimmt zu essen.
Angeblich bewirke dies, dass die Kinder sp√§ter mal nicht √ºbergewichtig werden, behauptete 2008 die britische Krankenschwester Gill Rapley, die Erfinderin des Baby Led Weanings. All diese Vorteile sah auch die Atlantic-Redakteurin Olga Khazan und testet die Erziehungsmethode, die √§hnlich umstritten ist wie die Kuss-F√ºtterung, bei ihrem sechs Monate alten Sohn. ‚ÄûEs hat fast mein Leben ruiniert‚Äú, schreibt sie danach.
Mutter testet Baby Led Weaning: Mein Sohn ‚Äûw√ºrgte so heftig, dass er sich √ºbergab‚Äú
‚ÄûIch mischte Putenhackfleisch mit S√º√ükartoffeln und legte es meinem Sohn hin. Z√∂gernd steckte er den Klumpen in den Mund. Innerhalb weniger Sekunden w√ºrgte er so heftig, dass er sich √ºbergab‚Äú, schreibt Khazan. Dieses W√ºrgen sei normal, sagen Baby-Wed-Leaning-Bef√ºrworter. Der Berufsverband der Kinder- und Jugend√§rzte hingegen bef√ºrchtet bei der Welt, dass sich Kinder verschlucken.
Ein Kinderern√§hrungsexperte warnt Khazan, dass viel W√ºrgen zu einer Aversion gegen jegliche Nahrung f√ºhren k√∂nne, egal ob vom L√∂ffel oder als feste Beikost. Ihr Sohn habe immer wieder gew√ºrgt, irgendwann kleine Bissen genommen und sie sofort wieder ausgespuckt. Mit fast einem Jahr, wo er eigentlich keine S√§uglingsnahrung mehr brauchen m√ºsste, habe er t√§glich nur 50 Kalorien feste Nahrung zu sich genommen. ‚ÄûWir wussten nicht, was wir tun sollten‚Äú, schreibt die Journalistin.
Im Internet st√∂√üt sie auf den Tipp, das Kind mit zerdr√ºckter oder p√ºrierter Nahrung (also Brei) zu f√ºttern, wenn Baby Led Weaning nicht funktioniere. Auch eine Kinder√§rztin habe ihr das empfohlen. ‚ÄûIch bekam das Gef√ºhl, dass es weniger wissenschaftliche Belege gibt, als Bef√ºrworter behaupten.‚Äú Der Ern√§hrungspsychologe Thomas Ellrott best√§tigt bei BuzzFeed News Deutschland von IPPEN.MEDIA: ‚ÄûDie wissenschaftliche Bewertung von m√∂glichen Vor- und Nachteilen ist beim Baby Led Weaning noch nicht mit der n√∂tigen Sicherheit m√∂glich.‚Äú
Baby Led Weaning: ‚ÄûMein Baby ist nicht besonders schlau‚Äú
Khazan spricht f√ºr ihren Text zu Baby Led Weaning mit einigen Experten und Expertinnen und stellt fest, dass es zwar f√ºr manche Babys gut ist, f√ºr manche aber auch das F√ºttern mit dem L√∂ffel mehr Sinn ergibt. ‚ÄûGrunds√§tzlich sollte Baby Led Weaning funktionieren k√∂nnen, da unsere fernen Vorfahren wahrscheinlich nicht immer Breikost zur Verf√ºgung stellen konnten‚Äú, sagt Ellrott BuzzFeed News Deutschland.
Doch das System und auch die Beratung in der Baby-Ern√§hrung seien auf den ‚Äû√úbergang mit einer Breikost-Phase optimiert‚Äú, erg√§nzt der Ern√§hrungspsychologe, der an der Georg-August-Universit√§t G√∂ttingen lehrt. ‚ÄûDas funktioniert in den meisten F√§llen auch gut.‚Äú Besonders bei Eltern wie Khazan, die feststellt, dass sie zu Hause eigentlich nie etwas koche, das ihr Baby auch essen d√ºrfe: salzige und scharfe So√üen etwa, Salate mit N√ºssen, Fertiggerichte und vieles mehr.
Selbstbestimmtheit hin oder her: ‚ÄûMein Baby ist nicht besonders schlau‚Äú, schreibt die Mutter. ‚ÄûLeider versteht es nicht instinktiv, wie man sich reich an verschiedenen Makron√§hrstoffen ern√§hrt, um die S√§uglingsnahrung altersgerecht zu erg√§nzen.‚Äú Das sei ihr Job und sie werde ihren Sohn dabei anleiten ‚Äì wo n√∂tig eben mit Babybrei.

author: the new york times
title: Las hormonas sexuales son hormonas cerebrales y podr√≠an ayudar a tratar el cerebro
text:
Las hormonas sexuales son hormonas cerebrales y podr√≠an ayudar a tratar el cerebro
Cuando los investigadores dieron nombre al estr√≥geno, estas eran las funciones que se le atribu√≠an: inducir el frenes√≠ y apoyar la salud sexual femenina.
Por: Rachel E. Gross
El estr√≥geno es la Meryl Streep de las hormonas, y su versatilidad es famosa entre los cient√≠ficos. Adem√°s de desempe√±ar un papel clave en la salud sexual y reproductiva, fortalece los huesos, mantiene la piel flexible, regula los niveles de az√∫car, aumenta el flujo sangu√≠neo, reduce la inflamaci√≥n y favorece el sistema nervioso central.
‚ÄúNombra un √≥rgano, y promueve la salud de ese √≥rgano‚Äù, dijo Roberta Brinton, neurocient√≠fica que dirige el Centro de Innovaci√≥n en Ciencias Cerebrales de la Universidad de Arizona.
Pero el reconocimiento del papel m√°s amplio del estr√≥geno ha tardado en llegar. El compuesto se identific√≥ por primera vez en 1923 y a partir de entonces se conoci√≥ como la ‚Äúhormona sexual femenina‚Äù, una reputaci√≥n unidimensional inherente a su propio nombre.
‚ÄúEstr√≥geno‚Äù viene del griego ‚Äúoestrus‚Äù, literalmente un t√°bano conocido por azotar al ganado en un frenes√≠ enloquecido. Cient√≠ficamente, el estro ha pasado a significar el periodo de los ciclos reproductivos de algunos mam√≠feros en el que las hembras son f√©rtiles y sexualmente activas.
Las mujeres no entran en estro; menstr√∫an. Sin embargo, cuando los investigadores dieron nombre al estr√≥geno, estas eran las funciones que se le atribu√≠an: inducir el frenes√≠ y apoyar la salud sexual femenina. Hoy en d√≠a, el estr√≥geno est√° ganando reconocimiento por lo que puede ser su papel m√°s importante: influir en el cerebro.
Los neurocient√≠ficos han aprendido que el estr√≥geno es vital para el desarrollo sano del cerebro, pero que tambi√©n contribuye a afecciones como la esclerosis m√∫ltiple y el alzh√©imer. Los cambios en los niveles de estr√≥geno ‚Äîprocedentes del ciclo menstrual o de fuentes externas‚Äî pueden exacerbar las migra√±as, las convulsiones y otros s√≠ntomas neurol√≥gicos comunes.
‚ÄúHay un gran n√∫mero de enfermedades neurol√≥gicas que pueden verse afectadas por las fluctuaciones de las hormonas sexuales‚Äù, dijo Hyman Schipper, neur√≥logo de la Universidad McGill, quien enumer√≥ una decena de ellas en una reciente revisi√≥n de la revista Brain Medicine. ‚ÄúY muchas de las terapias que se utilizan en medicina reproductiva deber√≠an reutilizarse para estas enfermedades neurol√≥gicas‚Äù.
En la actualidad, la idea de que las hormonas sexuales son tambi√©n hormonas cerebrales est√° transformando el modo en que los m√©dicos abordan la salud y las enfermedades cerebrales, y los ayuda a orientar el tratamiento, evitar interacciones perjudiciales y desarrollar nuevas terapias basadas en hormonas.
El estr√≥geno, en aumento
En las mujeres, el estr√≥geno se fabrica principalmente en los ovarios, aunque tambi√©n lo producen las gl√°ndulas suprarrenales y las c√©lulas adiposas. En los hombres, el estr√≥geno se convierte a partir de la testosterona en los test√≠culos y es crucial para la producci√≥n de esperma, la fuerza √≥sea, la funci√≥n hep√°tica, el metabolismo de las grasas y m√°s.
Pero en ambos sexos, el cerebro tambi√©n fabrica su propio estr√≥geno, lo que subraya su importancia neurol√≥gica. ‚ÄúEl cerebro es en parte un √≥rgano endocrino‚Äù, dijo Lisa Mosconi, neurocient√≠fica que dirige la Iniciativa del Cerebro Femenino en Weill Cornell Medicine.
Es rico en receptores de estr√≥geno, que se activan y desactivan a lo largo de la vida. Anteriormente se cre√≠a que estos se agrupaban en torno a estructuras con funciones reproductivas espec√≠ficas, como la hip√≥fisis y el hipot√°lamo. En realidad, ‚Äúest√°n por todas partes‚Äù, dijo Mosconi, quien desarroll√≥ una t√©cnica de exploraci√≥n por PET (Tomograf√≠a por Emisi√≥n de Positrones, por su sigla en ingl√©s) para ver estos receptores en un cerebro vivo. ‚ÄúNi siquiera pudimos encontrar una regi√≥n que estuviera completamente vac√≠a‚Äù, dijo.
En el cerebro, el estr√≥geno puede unirse directamente a los receptores de las neuronas y otras c√©lulas, desencadenando una cascada de acciones. Tambi√©n puede descomponerse en metabolitos, llamados neuroesteroides, que ejercen sus propios efectos de amplio alcance.
Algunos de estos neuroesteroides ya se han convertido en terapias propias: la alopregnanolona, un metabolito de la progesterona, es la base de un f√°rmaco utilizado para tratar ciertos tipos de epilepsia.
